title: Ending malnutrition by 2030 - Is India on target?
subtitle: Malnutrition is the most alarming and persistent health problem faced by the world today as per a recent report of the International Food Policy Research Institute. The frightening statistics of infant mortality and retardation raises serious questions about the development models pursued by governments across the globe.

title: Labour laws- Reforms for the few
subtitle: At a time when labour law reforms are being debated, it is important to remember that only 6-7% of the total workforce in the country come under the labour laws. The other 93-94% — the vast majority of the country’s nearly 500 million workforce — working in the informal or unorganised sector are outside the purview of these laws.

title: The link between poverty and health
subtitle: According to “The People’s Health Movement”, the main cause of poor health of millions across the world is poverty. Poverty is both a cause and a consequence of poor health

title: Poverty and academic outcomes - THE CRIPPLING EFFECT
subtitle: Family and social environment of children have a greater impact on their performance than the quality of teaching at school.

title: The never-ending ordeal of migrant workers
subtitle: Every year, hundreds of young people from villages arrive in cities in search of jobs with hopes of freedom from poverty and indebtedness, leaving behind their families, friends and homes.

title: Need to look into status of under trials
subtitle: More than 2.75 lakh undertrials are rotting in Indian prisons even though their guilt is yet to be proved
